channel.title: Community Skillcape Project

item.title: Community Skillcape Project
item.dc:creator: @Graffle Graffle
item.description:
@Graffle wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:21, topic:322927”][quote author=T3arful link=topic=419338.msg3083384#msg3083384 date=1262316288]

The emote file for the skillcapes that was provided by SWAT doesn’t load in the anim viewer, so it is corrupt.

Wrong, i dumped the same emote file from a 508 client, and i got the same result, no its not a currupt file, its the fact that its throwing an error when loading it, we need to convert the new header over so that we can succesfully load all of the 508 emotes.

It throws an error in the Anim viewer because the file is corrupt, why else would it not load? If the anim viewer cannot load the file it won’t load on the 317 client.

Also you need more than the header, you need to convert the skinlists also being that’s what is causing the error…
[/quote]
Oh, is it skinlists? Cause then we’ll need the stuff from the model class.[/quote]

Hmm, wouldnt it, if something just wouldnt load someone, but will somewhere else mean it is not corrupt? Just meaning that its loaded differently than what your trying to do? Just my opinion, but whatever.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Skillcape Project
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[quote=“T3arful, post:20, topic:322927”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=419338.msg3083068#msg3083068 date=1262292635]

The emote file for the skillcapes that was provided by SWAT doesn’t load in the anim viewer, so it is corrupt.

Wrong, i dumped the same emote file from a 508 client, and i got the same result, no its not a currupt file, its the fact that its throwing an error when loading it, we need to convert the new header over so that we can succesfully load all of the 508 emotes.
[/quote]
It throws an error in the Anim viewer because the file is corrupt, why else would it not load? If the anim viewer cannot load the file it won’t load on the 317 client.

Also you need more than the header, you need to convert the skinlists also being that’s what is causing the error…[/quote]
Oh, is it skinlists? Cause then we’ll need the stuff from the model class.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Skillcape Project
item.dc:creator: @T3arful T3arful
item.description:
@T3arful wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:19, topic:322927”][quote author=T3arful link=topic=419338.msg3082276#msg3082276 date=1262240113]
The emote file for the skillcapes that was provided by SWAT doesn’t load in the anim viewer, so it is corrupt.
[/quote]

Wrong, i dumped the same emote file from a 508 client, and i got the same result, no its not a currupt file, its the fact that its throwing an error when loading it, we need to convert the new header over so that we can succesfully load all of the 508 emotes.[/quote]
It throws an error in the Anim viewer because the file is corrupt, why else would it not load? If the anim viewer cannot load the file it won’t load on the 317 client.

Also you need more than the header, you need to convert the skinlists also being that’s what is causing the error…

Read full topic

item.title: Community Skillcape Project
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

T3arful:

The emote file for the skillcapes that was provided by SWAT doesn’t load in the anim viewer, so it is corrupt.

Wrong, i dumped the same emote file from a 508 client, and i got the same result, no its not a currupt file, its the fact that its throwing an error when loading it, we need to convert the new header over so that we can succesfully load all of the 508 emotes.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Skillcape Project
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[quote=“T3arful, post:14, topic:322927”][quote author=Goodbye RS, Hello RSPS link=topic=419338.msg3082156#msg3082156 date=1262229799]
Hmm cul.

Or you should look at my tutorial on Rewn-Serba and do it the correct way?

OnDemandFetcher

Search 65000

Replace with 99999

Gosh.
[/quote]

No you fucking idiot, that wouldn’t work at all. Did you even see what you was changing?
‘gzipInputBuffer’ Just because the max amount of frames is 65k you don’t search for 65000 in the client and change what you find then hope for the best. Besides that, your thread was deleted for idiocy, and there was like 20 people on that thread that posted the results of it being wrong.

@Cocoa, what is the point of posting the non renamed ones? Nobody will get anything from them, it’s hard enough with the ‘refactored’ ones.

You’re giving the codes to us, so you want us to help you making skillcape emotes like the ones SWAT has? And then release it to public?

Yes that’s the idea.

Is the reason because of a corrupt file?

The emote file for the skillcapes that was provided by SWAT doesn’t load in the anim viewer, so it is corrupt.[/quote]
But by corrupt I thought he meant like it was broken cause SWAT dumped it wrong or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Skillcape Project
item.dc:creator: @T3arful T3arful
item.description:
@T3arful wrote:

[quote=“Goodbye RS, Hello RSPS, post:11, topic:322927”]Hmm cul.

Or you should look at my tutorial on Rewn-Serba and do it the correct way?

OnDemandFetcher

Search 65000

Replace with 99999

Gosh.[/quote]

No you fucking idiot, that wouldn’t work at all. Did you even see what you was changing?
‘gzipInputBuffer’ Just because the max amount of frames is 65k you don’t search for 65000 in the client and change what you find then hope for the best. Besides that, your thread was deleted for idiocy, and there was like 20 people on that thread that posted the results of it being wrong.

@Cocoa, what is the point of posting the non renamed ones? Nobody will get anything from them, it’s hard enough with the ‘refactored’ ones.

Berky-Scape:

You’re giving the codes to us, so you want us to help you making skillcape emotes like the ones SWAT has? And then release it to public?

Yes that’s the idea.

cocoa:

Is the reason because of a corrupt file?

The emote file for the skillcapes that was provided by SWAT doesn’t load in the anim viewer, so it is corrupt.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Skillcape Project
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

Berky-Scape:

You’re giving the codes to us, so you want us to help you making skillcape emotes like the ones SWAT has? And then release it to public?

I’m giving the codes to everyone, so that everyone can works towards them together. Whether you choose to help everyone is up to you. I’m just providing the tools necessary minus the model class which I will now be getting.

Read full topic

Or you should look at my tutorial on Rewn-Serba and do it the correct way?

Replace with 99999

Gosh.

item.title: Community Skillcape Project
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Berky-Scape:

You’re giving the codes to us, so you want us to help you making skillcape emotes like the ones SWAT has? And then release it to public?

The problem is, some of the 474+ emote files are throwing one of these 3 problems:

[ul][]New animation header
[]Size of frames
[*]Amount of frames in the file[/ul]

If we change the 474+ emote header over to the 317 then we wont have any problem getting the new emotes to load.

Read full topic

item.title: Community Skillcape Project
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

T3arful:

Your first priority should be redumping the animations, since the skillcape file in SWAT’s dump is corrupt, regardless if you managed to expand how many frames the client can handle and if you converted the header, it still wouldn’t work.

Is the reason because of a corrupt file?

Read full topic

item.title: Community Skillcape Project
item.dc:creator: @T3arful T3arful
item.description:
@T3arful wrote:

Your first priority should be redumping the animations, since the skillcape file in SWAT’s dump is corrupt, regardless if you managed to expand how many frames the client can handle and if you converted the header, it still wouldn’t work.

Read full topic
